title: If shaco is smited by skirmishers don't let him stealth the vision off.

replies.body: Why? Twitch can do it, Rengar can do it, Zix can do it. o.o

I'd have to test with the smite but I'm fairly certain any skill that grants vision still goes for the full duration, even if the target stealths afterwards...it's kind of pointless to spend time/money on something that does that when you can just go *poof* and it's gone. If Shaco & co. can have a get out of jail free card, then you'd have to also remove the ability to discern Shaco from his clone by checking for your ignite/exhaust/other obvious signs. It just makes sense that they wouldn't get to cancel your reveal.

None of it cancels the reveal, they just can't be seen in stealth until the duration ends. After it ends, it's fine. The item itself even states this. I'll go ahead and quote the entire item's words and bold the section.

"Challenging Smite can target enemy champions, marking them for 6 seconds. Marked enemies are revealed **(does not reveal stealth)**, take (54 + 6 × level) true damage over 3 seconds from your basic attacks and deal 20% reduced damage to you. "

This is completely intentional. If you need to see stealth, you can get an upgraded Sweeper.

It just makes sense that they wouldn't get to cancel your reveal.

Go test it and come back, we'll wait.  I already know that's what happening.

I don't really need to since other spells with reveal mechanics already do the job and don't get canceled by stealth. I'm agreeing with you, that it makes no sense to have that interaction while letting them escape the Smite's reveal.
Except it makes perfect sense because the item itself says it doesn't reveal stealth. It's... kind of not that item's place to do that. o.o
The point of the item is to win duels. That means having a vision and damage advantage over your opponent. If the opponent can literally stealth away your smite, that seems a little ridiculous.

And the point of stealth is to escape. You could say the same thing about a Dash. "Oh, he smited me with Skirmisher's, I'll just escape for the next six seconds for it to wear off."

The entire point of Skirmisher's is to duel. If your opponent decides they're not going to be stupid and face tank you when they have 20% reduced damage, are taking true damage from your attacks, and are revealed, then they're playing the way they should be.

And yet, if the opponent dashes over a wall after you use Skirmisher's on them, you *know exactly where they are and can potentially follow them with your own gapcloser.* If they stealth away, you have to guess which way they go - and as someone who plays a good amount of Twitch, I might point out that they could just as easily watch to see where *you* go and go the opposite way.

The thing is, Skirmisher's has a good amount of counterplay already - it provides dominance bonuses, but you react the exact same way you normally would against a superior opponent. You run. You escape. Potentially, you bait. The smite bonus means they have an easier time keeping up with you, but that's the whole point - it rewards them for smiting. The fact that you can completely erase that with a stealth is absurd.

Yeah, but Skirmishers isn't meant to make them visible. It's to make it to where you can out duel some one, usually some one in your jungle and occasionally outside of your jungle or you can just pop it on their most fed carry in a team fight so you can avoid some damage. If they're in your jungle and you did this and they stealthed away then bam, it did it's job. It got them the hell out of your jungle and if it's outside of the jungle and you're trying to use it for vision, you're likely using it wrong. This item isn't "You're a carry jungle and now you can murder any stealth champ with this item". It's meant for Bruisers and tanks who want to be able to avoid some damage, not for a Master Yi or WW to be able to counter jungle with incredible ease, hence why it was nerfed to begin with.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=HbFiKxZB,comment-id=00000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-01T07:32:04.278+0000)
>
> Yeah, but Skirmishers isn't meant to make them visible. 

If it wasn't intended to make them visible, *it wouldn't make them visible.*

Skirmisher's Sabre smite, like almost any other buff/debuff in the game, is designed to provide a window of power for a player to exploit. It says, "For this duration, you are able to wreck target champion's face." It gives visibility *specifically* so that you can track them in jungle as they try to escape, outplay you, or otherwise disorient you via lack of vision.

It isn't designed specifically to waste stealth champs. It's just that it's *absurd* that a stealth champ can completely fucking ignore the item.

Skirmisher's is NOT supposed to be that at all. It's meant to give you an edge, yes. It gives you vision if they're trying to escape through bushes or trying to out play you with the bushes or happened to have flashed into the Fog of War. It's NOT meant to let you destroy every stealth champ. The visibility it gives is meant so you can follow them if they try to bush juke you, not so you can chase a stealth champion. They'd have let it reveal stealth if it was meant to, but stealth already has Lee Sin as an issue, a Lens, Twisted Fate, and of course the various issues that come with stealth. Twitch can't stealth if you hit him constantly, the delay is up to about 7 seconds. Rengar's delay is about 3 seconds. Zix's stealth is only for 1s with a 2s CD before using the next 1s stealth, going up to 2s if you evolve it, which you don't oftenly do early on and nowadays you don't do it often in general. Evelynn obviously isn't an issue here and neither is Teemo. Shaco though, his stealth is part of his escape. You can already use Skirmisher's to see which Shaco is which if he doesn't have buffs and even if it did show him in his stealth, it wouldn't help since he's likely going over a wall and dropping a box for you run into. There's simply no point in letting Skirmisher's reveal stealth.
Don't let any of them do it.

Smite should not reveal stealth based on the fact that red trinket is already a hard counter to stealth and built on junglers. The only champ thats broken stealth wise is Rengar, as he just jumps at you from outside stealth reveal range.

Do it riot.

Let it reveal stealth.
